spans.text: (The irreplaceable, heart-stirring power... How to embody it in a song.)
(It can't be achieved by superficial agitation based on momentary emotions. What I need is real power - this power that I, who used to be accustomed to frustration, could not conceive.)
(Reality... huh?)
(Observe the world more carefully? With loving eyes? Discover a different kind of beauty in the ordinary world - I seem to recall seeing this in inspirational articles, will it be useful?)
(I can only try anything at this point.)
(It's not even dark yet, there are no stars at all...)
(The streetlights are already on, so how about looking at the lights? Not bad, I guess.)
(Looking at the houses? The sign of this store is a bit peeling. That cafe has a carpet, it's a puzzle of kittens. Not pandas, huh...)
(...It's good that it's not pandas, so they won't get stepped on.)
(Doing this is useless after all, isn't it.)
Huh?
A black cat jumped out of the shadows of the alley.
(Ah, a black cat. Those purple eyes, it's definitely that one!)
(What on earth is going on...)
The black cat glanced at Taki, then turned back into the alley.
Hey!
By the time Taki rushed over, the black cat was long gone.
Where did it run off to...
(That guy wouldn't...)
At this moment, a black shadow came with wind pressure.
Startled, Taki quickly took several steps back.
The roar of the engine suddenly climbed to a limit, tearing at Taki's eardrums.
(I'm going to get hit!)
(Is it possible to die even before the countdown ends?!)
The expected impact never happened. The gust of wind and sound that had just hit her face had disappeared.
Taki clutched her pounding chest, confirming that she was still alive.
Immediately, she felt infinite anger - for her recent experiences, and also for this biker who was recklessly rampaging in the alley.
Who is it that's so...
...Umiri?
Taki, what are you doing here?
Are you okay?
I'm okay.
(...As expected, I still won't die before the countdown ends.)
(...If it were anyone else riding like this, I would definitely scold them to shreds.)
Do you know it's dangerous to ride like that!
Sorry.
Seeing that you're still so energetic, it seems you're fine.

Umiri raised her sunglasses, revealing a pair of calm lake-green eyes. She was wearing a black leather jacket, a khaki cropped top that revealed her midriff, black ripped jeans, and a windproof pure black bandana around her neck.
In Taki's impression, Umiri, who wasn't considered tall, controlled this CFMOTO 450SR large motorcycle with a seat height of 795mm and a weight of 168kg without the slightest sense of incongruity.
In fact, Umiri was leaning far off the center of the seat to support herself with one foot. But her aura gave people the ease of having everything under control.
(This guy has no intention of reflecting at all. A delinquent.)
(Did she learn bad habits from hanging out with musicians in society?)
That was close.
If you ride so wildly, what if you actually hit someone one day!
I'll slow down when approaching intersections. I also flashed the headlights to indicate there was a vehicle.
Other people usually notice it.
...You flashed the lights just now?
(How did I not see it.)
Yeah.
(Could it be that I was only paying attention to the cat?)
(...That's right, where's the cat. The motorcycle engine sound is so loud, the black cat should have been startled by Umiri and run out. This distance...)
(But before I walked in, let alone the lights, I didn't even hear the motorcycle engine sound... How strange.)
Umiri, have you seen a black cat?
Black cat? Didn't see it.
...Didn't see it?
(Umiri should definitely be able to see it, it just darted into this alley.)
What's wrong?
But I just saw it dart into this alley, just a few seconds ago.
So you ignored my lights and engine sound because you were chasing a black cat?
I thought you only liked pandas. So cats are okay too?
Huh?
This and that are two different things!
I'm just asking if you saw a black cat!
Didn't see it.
Is that black cat important? You're so concerned about it.
(I feel like saying more will only make things more troublesome.)
...It's nothing, forget it.
By the way, why are you here?
I don't remember you having any work that requires you to specifically pass by my house.
(Still something's not right...)
(The black cat just went in, and Umiri appeared, it's as if the cat turned into Umiri. The fur is also black.)
Taki, your eyes are strange.
Is it? Just an illusion.
(Still so sharp.)
(That sharpness is also especially like a cat.)
...Let's just say it's an illusion.
It's nothing big, just going to have a meal at that izakaya we often go to nearby.
I was also planning to go there to check it out.
But the old shopkeeper has been sick and out of business for the past few days, so be prepared for it to be closed.
...He usually drinks too much alcohol.
Together?
Umiri took the helmet from the hook in front of the car and handed it to Taki.
Taki took the helmet and put it on. She gave the empty alley one last glance - no black cat, only the protruding air conditioner frame on the outer wall.
Umiri sat forward, leaving enough space for Taki. Taki supported Umiri's shoulder and straddled the motorcycle lightly.
She hesitated for a moment, put one hand on Umiri's shoulder, and the other hand supported the side of the base.
(The pose is so awkward...)
(When will this Umiri graduate from crop tops.)
(...But I won't see that day.)
It's dangerous if you don't hold on tight.
You're telling me, what about your own helmet?
I didn't expect to carry anyone today, so I only brought one helmet.
But just now, you weren't wearing a helmet either.
I'll put it on if I see the police.
This is a safety ques—
The engine roared suddenly, the throttle was fully opened, and the sudden acceleration caused Taki to subconsciously hug Umiri's waist.
The motorcycle sped off. The whistling wind blew Taki's long hair, but luckily the helmet held it in place, so her hairstyle wouldn't be too messy and affect her vision.
There was little traffic along the way, the speed was just below the speeding line, and the scenery on both sides receded rapidly.
